text: Hi all! If you want to invite people to this slack, we ask that you direct them to this link: <https://contributor.r-project.org/slack>, so that they see the overview, posting guide and code of conduct before joining. Thanks!

attachments.text: R Contributor Site - for people interested in contributing to R core development
attachments.title: R-devel Slack

elements.text: Hi all! If you want to invite people to this slack, we ask that you direct them to this link:
, so that they see the overview, posting guide and code of conduct before joining. Thanks!

text:
Hello <@U01DZUA88S1>,

I am Aryan Kenchappagol, currently a pre-final year computer engineering student at the International Institute of Information Technology Pune, India. I am decently experienced in the open-source domain and have been a Google Summer of Code 2021 Student Developer with *OSGeo: Open Source Geospatial Foundation*. Here is the link to my <https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/archive/2021/projects/6036322531147776/|project idea> and my <https://github.com/aryanxk02/mapmint/wiki/GSoC-2021:-Final-Report|final report> for GSoC 2021.

I was going through the ideas list for Google Season of Docs 2022. I came across the accepted proposal titled, <https://developers.google.com/season-of-docs/docs/participants#:~:text=Expand%20and%20Reorganize%20the%20R%20Development%20Guide|Expand and Reorganize the R Development Guide>. After going through the <https://github.com/rstats-gsod/gsod2022/issues|issues list> present in the <https://github.com/rstats-gsod/gsod2022/|rstats-gsod/gsod2022> repository, the <https://github.com/rstats-gsod/gsod2022/issues/4|current issue> (idea for GSoD 2022) i.e converting the CRAN website to a more modern framework has caught my attention.

I am looking forward to knowing more about the project considering my previous experience with CRAN packages during my Google Summer of Code 2021 with OSGeo.

I am quite interested in working on this project. I am thinking of using <https://docusaurus.io/|Docusaurus> to achieve the goal. Do check it out. Basically, it is a tool developed to generate and publish documentation websites. I have tried Docusaurus earlier and I think it goes completely well with the current problem statement for GSoD 2022.

Do let me know what you think about this. Hoping for a positive response.

Thank you :)

Best Regards,
Aryan Kenchappagol

attachments.text: Google Summer of Code is a global program focused on bringing more developers into open source software development.
attachments.title: Google Summer of Code

attachments.fallback: Google Developers: Season of Docs  |  Google Developers

text: Hi Arayan, There were a couple of issues marked as ideas for 2022 that were transferred from the 2021 repo. So in fact all the issues on the 2022 repo were considered for this year and as you noticed, the development guide project was the one we picked to make a proposal for. This is the one that was accepted for GSoD 2022 and we have writers lined up for this. Regarding the CRAN website proposal, we are not looking to use a completely new documentation framework, but merely update the current template to meet modern web standards. This would need support from the CRAN team and we did not get as far as trying to discuss it with them. So I don't think this idea is going anywhere at the moment.

This is the one that was accepted for GSoD 2022 and we have writers lined up for this. Regarding the CRAN website proposal, we are not looking to use a completely new documentation framework, but merely update the current template to meet modern web standards. This would need support from the CRAN team and we did not get as far as trying to discuss it with them. So I don't think this idea is going anywhere at the moment.
